"Ah, heeey!": "Hey there."
"Now here's a rare sight."
"Ilma, why're you here?"

"I was called in to attend
Manon and the others' hearings."

"I was called in to attend
Manon and the others' hearings."
"And I just wanted to ask him how it went."

"You can both rest easy.
Both Manon and Faria are doing well."

"I can imagine it's rather nerve-wracking,
but they didn't look unhappy with their treatment."
"The same could be said for the other Resurgent ARKS."
"There is just one problem..."
"Did the hearing not go well?"
"Couldn't come to a conclusion?"
"Yeeeah. They're not making it very easy for us."
"Well, there is that, too."

"They all had their own roles to play on Leciel,
each of them with different responsibilities."

"As a result, some testimonies couldn't be corroborated,
so we've had troubles coming to definite conclusions."
"But, what's even more troublesome than that..."
"...is the issue of making ourselves mutually understood."

"For example, \"Can you tell us about Leciel?\"
...That's a question, right?"

"But if you asked them, they'd start explaining the structure of
Leciel itself, and its various functions, down to every little detail."
"As if they were emotionless machines responding to a data query."
"...Manon was like that when she first arrived."

"You'd talk to her and she'd
just give bare-minimum responses."
"People weren't really sure what to do about her."
"Maybe that's just normal for them."
"But Manon is different now."
"Yeah."

"We're actually able to reach a
measure of understanding with Manon."

"Perhaps, if given enough time, the others
may also eventually change like she has..."
"...That's what I'd like to think."
"Also, another thing about them..."
"From now on, we're going to refer to their people as \"Lecielan\"."
"Lecielan?"
"They're no longer our enemies."

"If we just keep calling them \"Resurgent ARKS\",
it could harm our rapport with them."
"...Lecielan."
"Yeah. It sounds nice."
